page.title: 05Women's Institute
page.content: The W.I. meets one evening a month and is a purely socila gathering with a talk and supper. Being a national institution, one member attends County and National meetings during the year where views of national interest are discussed and resolutions put forward to the relevant bodies. In the past it was one of the few forms of entertainment for County women, with talks that were both informative and entertaining. With the advent of television and the facility of private transport this is no longer of such importance and it is difficult to keep up numbers. The present meetings are attended by about 10 members.
